Best viewed in 1024x768

Routines

The routines on this page were written by members of the ACZ. You should only use these routines if you are an accomplished programmer and want to take advantage of their optimization. If you are just beginning and simply copy these routines into your program without fully understanding how they work, you will not learn anything and there is a good chance that you will mess something up. They are also a good source to learn from, so if you want to learn how to do something, look here!

Feel free to use them, but be sure to give credit where credit is due!

DrawMap Draws an 8x16 tilemap to the screen
DoMenu Displays a nice looking bar menu (table driven)
CalcOff Turns off the calculator (stays in program)
Link86 Link port -- SendByte and ReceiveByte routines
FindPixel CLEM's highly optimized FindPixel routines (two)
PutSprite Draws a sprite to the screen
GraySprite A modification of PutSprite (above) for grayscale
RPMult Russian Peasant's Algorithm -- fast multiplication
DisplayHL Prints HL to the screen with leading zeros eliminated
TextView Lets the user scroll a text file up or down
SoundAlgo Dux's General Sound Algorithm -- plays WAVs
AnimCont Interrupt based animation controller
